page.title: 18Transport
page.content: Cheddleton was linked with the national railways until closed by Mr. Beeching. The lines are still intact and are used by the local railway museum to exercise engines and carriages they have renovated. The canal was used extensively in bringing coal to the paper mills,collecting goods & transporting them to Ivy House, Hanley, another paper mill. The canal fell into disrepair when road transport was found to be much cheaper and more convenient. Around 1963 the canal was cleared and repaired for recreational purposes. Two bus companies serve the village- Berisfords and Proctors.Many residents run their own transport and commute to surrounding towns and Stoke-on-Trent. The main road divides the village, going south to Cellarhead.
